relatedDocuments.title: Regional Gross Value Added (Income Approach), December 2013
relatedDocuments.summary: Shows economic activity as measured by Gross Value Added (GVA) for English regions, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland including component totals and industry group totals.

title: East of England Gross Value Added

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.

breadcrumb.title: Gross Value Added (GVA)
breadcrumb.summary: Gross Value Added (GVA) measures the contribution to the economy of each individual producer, industry or sector. In the UK it is used in the estimation of Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
